unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever wonder what makes a video or a meme explode faster than a jalebi fresh out of the kadhai? In the ever-changing world of social media and influencer marketing, understanding virality trends is crucial, especially if you’re trying to make your brand or content stand out in a sea of… well, everything!

In the ever-changing world of social media and influencer marketing, understanding virality trends is crucial, especially if you’re trying to make your brand or content stand out in a sea of… well, everything!

unnormalised: Lately, I've been seeing some fascinating trends emerge, particularly here in India. For starters, the short-form video format is still King. Reels, TikTok (even with the ban – workarounds exist, folks!), YouTube Shorts – these are where the eyeballs are. Think about Bhuvan Bam's latest skit; it gained millions of views within hours of dropping! Content needs to be snackable, engaging, and instantly shareable. Remember that crazy dance trend from Pune last month, the "Bhakri Twist"? It took off like wildfire.

unnormalised: Another big trend is the use of regional languages and cultural references. Something relatable to the average Amit from Ahmedabad or Priya from Prayagraj. Slang, local dialects, references to Bollywood classics, even inside jokes specific to a particular state can make your content way more relatable and shareable. Think using "Aiyyo!" for exaggerated reactions, or referencing dialogues from Sholay. It works, trust me!

unnormalised: So, what does this mean for you? Keep your content short, relatable, and culturally relevant. Be ready to jump on trends quickly – the window of opportunity can close faster than you can say "chai." And most importantly, be authentic. People can smell a fake a mile away.

unnormalised: Remember to analyze data. Check out what's trending on Google Trends India, pay attention to what influencers like Prajakta Koli are doing, and don't be afraid to experiment. The digital landscape changes daily; what worked on 26/01/2023 might be outdated by 09:00 hrs the next day. The next big thing might be just around the corner - maybe something launching at 15/08/2024 (Independence day marketing, anyone?). Good luck, and go viral! Let's aim for 1 million views, minimum, eh?
